law.catch_line: The purpose of the State Team is to prevent child deaths by:...

text.section:
The purpose of the State Team is to prevent child deaths by:
Developing an understanding of the causes and incidence of child deaths;
Developing plans for and implementing changes within the agencies represented on the State Team to prevent child deaths; and
Advising the Governor, the General Assembly, and the public on changes to law, policy, and practice to prevent child deaths.

The State Team shall coordinate its activities under this section with the State Citizens Review Board for Children, local citizens review panels, and the State Council on Child Abuse and Neglect in order to avoid unnecessary duplication of effort.

section.section:
Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, members and staff of the State Team:
May not disclose to any person or government official any identifying information about any specific child protection case about which the State Team is provided information; and
May make public other information unless prohibited by law.

In carrying out the responsibilities under this section and subject to subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, the members and staff of the State Team may provide identifying information to a national center for child death review in accordance with a data use agreement that:
Authorizes access to identifiable information only to the members and staff of the State Team;
Authorizes the national center for child death review to access only de-identified information; and
Requires the national center for child death review to act as a fiduciary agent of the State and local teams.

Information provided to a national center for child death review in accordance with this subsection is confidential and subject to the same confidentiality and discovery protections that apply to the State and local teams as set forth in § 5-709 of this subtitle.

text.section: In addition to any other penalties provided by law, the Secretary may impose on any person who violates subsection (d) of this section a civil penalty not exceeding $500 for each violation.
